comments.text: While working on bug 678343, I found that parsing a calIIcalComponent into the javascript objects we use in calEvent/calTodo costs around 30 ms on my machine. This of course adds up with a lot of events and causes UI freeze. I have some work in progress code that takes care, but its not quite ready yet. Using this bug for tracking.
comments.author: philipp@bugzilla.kewis.ch
comments.creator: philipp@bugzilla.kewis.ch
comments.raw_text: While working on bug 678343, I found that parsing a calIIcalComponent into the javascript objects we use in calEvent/calTodo costs around 30 ms on my machine. This of course adds up with a lot of events and causes UI freeze. I have some work in progress code that takes care, but its not quite ready yet. Using this bug for tracking.
I *think* this is the patch I referenced. Not quite sure. Its far from ready yet. Attaching so it doesn't get lost. Anyone is invited to pick up this patch!

comments.raw_text: This would help startup performance, eg bug 487832 ?

comments.text: This would help startup performance, eg bug 487832 ?

comments.text: I'm sure it will, constructing items now takes 30-40ms, with this patch we could cut it down to the minimum, e.g. 10-20ms.
